title.narrative: AMA - Gender Equality for Women Emp - LA

description.narrative: Gender equality is a sensitive issue for Hmong ethnic minority group to discusses at the household. Hmong women who live in three target villages where we work facing domestic violent, they do not have rights to participate at family planning, manage family assets and plan for their child education. Base on traditional practice Hmong man / husband will take lead and manage the family, they have rights to make a decision for family, manage an asset and expenditure for the family. Base on this behave women are automaticallylost their rights. In addition Hmong man who has fully rights and power does not play good care of the family. They look after another young Hmong girl, drug addict, just enjoy their life not pay the responsibility for the family, which one of the main cause to violet the women and children. Base on LSIS report 2017 found that 39.2 percent of Hmong women are facing with domestic violent and 29.1 percent said that it is normal for them to be beaten by their husband. Apart of that Hmong man / husband doesn#t see the important of the antenatal care, based on LSIS 2017 found that only 61.3 percent of Hmong women have antenatal care when they are pregnant. In addition the family doesn#t see the important of supporting Hmong girl education, the family believes that girl is a property of their family in-law they will not gains from investing girl. Based on LSIS 2017 found that only 39.9 percent of Hmong women age 15-45 can read and write, which mean that girl lost an opportunity to develop themselves, many of them just help family work and end up with child married. Capacity building for gender equality practice at household will use Gender Action Learning System (GALs) to train and discuss with target family. Association of Mutual Assistant (AMA) has a strong vision to integrate gender in all programs,activity. We are planning to set up a strong TOT team in the organization to promote gender equality of the Hmong minority group. We will coordinate and ask for a technical support from Women Participating in Development Association (MHP) and Gender Development Association as well as get a technical support from Learning Development Association for organizational management and networking. The project will help build the capacity of AMA TOT team, AMA TOT team will train the village authorities, family and support village women to monitor and promote gender equality in the family. In addition, AMA will be expanding this knowledge to AMA#s members andprogrammers.

participating-org.narrative:
Association for Mutual Assistant was initiative established in 1995 to assist Hmong migrate who move from rural high heel mountain to stay at the accessible villages in order to access health care services, education, communication and look for sustain occupationin order to reduce slash and burn for agriculture. Many of Hmong family who moved from high heel mountain face a lot of problem to start new life; they had limited agriculture land, and live in far from each other. Apart of that not help one each other when got seriously sick and dead. Poor families unable to prepare funeral ceremony.
In 1996, the director of Association for Mutual Assistantsee the needs, he initiated gather 14 Hmong families to establish the saving fund for help poor familywho seriously sick and dead. Through this practice the number of members had increase to 916 families, local authorities found that the saving fund able to assist the poor Hmong family and gather Hmong unity. The local authorizes the paper to establish the organization.
Base on the authorization and supporting of the government the association also create a project to assist Hmong ethnic minority access to justice and reserves of traditional of the Hmong and help build the capacity of village authorities to manage land and forest in the target community. Based on the Decree of Non-Profit Association AMA have registered as NPA and growth as members of 1,387 families, which population of 10,887 people, 5,435 people are women, 95% of them are Hmong, 3% Khmu and 2% Lao loum. AMA work in 30 villages in four districts, name LPB City, Pakou, Phonexay and XiengNgeurn. In LPB AMA is only one organization who work directs with ethnic minorities group, the organization has developing the activity, project in tothe three programmers: 1. Unity and saving assist programmes 2. Reserves and promote culture and traditional practices among ethnic minority. 3. Development Programme: Education for ethnic minority girl, health, livelihood and environment protection. Women and child protection.
AMA has integrated gender equality practice to all AMA programmer and activity. We found that GALs is very good tool and suitable to our target group.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
